events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle hitting a tree after losing control on a wet road.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and damage description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle communication and claim processing.
The insurance company acknowledged the receipt of the claim and confirmed it is under review.
Request sent to the customer for submitting photographs of the damaged vehicle and police report.
Customer submitted all required documents including photos of the vehicle and an official police report.
The investigation into the claim was initiated to verify details and estimate repair costs.
Investigation concluded that the claim is valid and repair costs are covered under policy terms.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on the assessed damage and coverage limits.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the service.
The claim was officially approved for the agreed settlement amount without any further issues.
Payment for the settlement amount was issued to the customerâ€™s account promptly after approval.
The claim was successfully closed after payment and all necessary procedures were completed.
The claim file was archived in compliance with company policy for future reference if needed.
